garlic.client¶

Implementation of Client.

Functions

deserialise_response(response[, relay_obj, …])

Deserialise API response using bridge/relay deserialisation objects.

onionoo_parameterised([restrict])

Handle generic passing of parameters to direct API functions.

Classes

Cache(factory[, enable_cache, ttl, enable])

Client([max_retries, timeout, enable_cache, …])

Object to request resources from the Onionoo API.

ContentNotChanged(response)

HTTP response for 403 occurence when If-Modified-Since header is set.

Endpoint(value)

Representation of API endpoints.

Bases: object

HTTP response for 403 occurence when If-Modified-Since header is set.

Parameters

response (Response) – HTTP response.

Return type

None

garlic.client.deserialise_response(response, relay_obj=None, bridge_obj=None)[source]¶

Deserialise API response using bridge/relay deserialisation objects. Optionally return raw http response if ContentNotChanged.

Parameters

  • response (Union[Response, PartialRawResponse, ContentNotChanged]) – API response.

  • relay_obj (Optional[Deserialisable]) – Object to deserialise array of relay descriptors into.

  • bridge_obj (Optional[Deserialisable]) – Object to deserialise array of bridge descriptors into.

Return type

Union[Response, Response]

Returns

Serialised response or raw HTTP response.

garlic.client.onionoo_parameterised(restrict=None)[source]¶

Handle generic passing of parameters to direct API functions.

Parameters

restrict (Set[str]) –

class garlic.client.Endpoint(value)[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Representation of API endpoints.

Variables

  • BASE – API base endpoint.

  • SUMMARY – Summary document endpoint.

  • DETAILS – Details document endpoint.

  • BANDWIDTH – Bandwidth document endpoint.

  • WEIGHTS – Weights document endpoint.

  • CLIENTS – Clients document endpoint.

  • UPTIME – Uptime document endpoint.

class garlic.client.Client(max_retries=5, timeout=60, enable_cache=True, cache_ttl=3600)[source]¶

Bases: object

Object to request resources from the Onionoo API.

Instantiate object.

Parameters

  • max_retries (int) – Maximum number of requests to the API per resource before bailing.

  • timeout (int) – Timeout for each request before issuing another request.

  • enable_cache (bool) – Enable request caching.

  • cache_ttl (int) – Lifetime of each cache entry (seconds).

async _request(verb, url, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Issue request to Onionoo API.

Parameters

  • verb (str) – HTTP verb.

  • url (str) – Destination URL.

Return type

PartialRawResponse

async get_summary(**kwargs)[source]¶

Get summary document from API.

Parameters

  • type (str) – Specify to return only “relay” or “bridge” descriptors.

  • running (bool) – Return only running bridges/or relays.

  • lookup (str) – Return only the relay with the parameter value matching the fingerprint or the bridge with the parameter value matching the hashed fingerprint.

  • country (str) – Return only relays which are located in the given country as identified by a two-letter country code. Filtering by country code is case-insensitive. The special country code xz can be used for relays that were not found in the GeoIP database.

  • as (str) – Return only relays which are located in either one of the given autonomous systems (AS) as identified by AS number (with or without preceding “AS” part). Multiple AS numbers can be provided separated by commas. Filtering by AS number is case insensitive. The special AS number 0 can be used for relays that were not found in the GeoIP database.

  • as_name (str) – Return only relays with the parameter value matching part of) the autonomous system (AS) name they are located in. If the parameter value contains spaces, only relays are returned which contain all space-separated parts in their AS name.

  • flag (Flag) – Return only relays which have the given relay flag assigned by the directory authorities.

  • first_seen_days (str) – Return only relays or bridges which have first been seen during the given range of days ago. A parameter value “x-y” with x <= y returns relays or bridges that have first been seen at least x and at most y days ago. Accepted short forms are “x”, “x-“, and “-y” which are interpreted as “x-x”, “x-infinity”, and “0-y”.

  • last_seen_days (str) – Return only relays or bridges which have last been seen during the given range of days ago. A parameter value “x-y” with x <= y returns relays or bridges that have last been seen at least x and at most y days ago. Accepted short forms are “x”, “x-“, and “-y” which are interpreted as “x-x”, “x-infinity”, and “0-y”.

  • contact (str) – Return only relays with the parameter value matching (part of) the contact line. If the parameter value contains spaces, only relays are returned which contain all space-separated parts in their contact line.

  • family (str) – Return only the relay whose fingerprint matches the parameter value and all relays that this relay has listed in its family by fingerprint and that in turn have listed this relay in their family by fingerprint.

  • version (str) – Return only relays or bridges running either Tor version from a list or range given in the parameter value. Tor versions must be provided without the leading “Tor” part. Multiple versions can either be provided as a comma-separated list (“,”), as a range separated by two dots (“..”), or as a list of ranges.

  • os (str) – Return only relays or bridges running on an operating system that starts with the parameter value.

  • host_name (str) – Return only relays with a domain name ending in the given (partial) host name. Searches for subdomains of a specific domain should ideally be prefixed with a period, for example: “.csail.mit.edu”.

  • recommended_version (bool) – Return only relays and bridges running a Tor software version that is recommended if recommended_version

  • order (Tuple[str]) – Re-order results by a comma-separated list of fields in ascending or descending order. Results are first ordered by the first list element, then by the second, and so on. Possible fields for ordering are: consensus_weight and first_seen. Field names are case-insensitive. Ascending order is the default; descending order is selected by prepending fields with a minus sign (-). Field names can be listed at most once in either ascending or descending order. Relays or bridges which don’t have any value for a field to be ordered by are always appended to the end, regardless or sorting order.

  • offset (int) – Skip the given number of relays and/or bridges. Relays are skipped first, then bridges.

  • limit (int) – Limit result to the given number of relays and/or bridges.

Return type

Response

async get_details(**kwargs)[source]¶

Get (partial)details document from API. Partial details are returned if the fields argument is applied.

Parameters

  • type (str) – Specify to return only “relay” or “bridge” descriptors.

  • running (bool) – Return only running bridges/or relays.

  • lookup (str) – Return only the relay with the parameter value matching the fingerprint or the bridge with the parameter value matching the hashed fingerprint.

  • country (str) – Return only relays which are located in the given country as identified by a two-letter country code. Filtering by country code is case-insensitive. The special country code xz can be used for relays that were not found in the GeoIP database.

  • as (str) – Return only relays which are located in either one of the given autonomous systems (AS) as identified by AS number (with or without preceding “AS” part). Multiple AS numbers can be provided separated by commas. Filtering by AS number is case insensitive. The special AS number 0 can be used for relays that were not found in the GeoIP database.

  • as_name (str) – Return only relays with the parameter value matching part of) the autonomous system (AS) name they are located in. If the parameter value contains spaces, only relays are returned which contain all space-separated parts in their AS name.

  • flag (Flag) – Return only relays which have the given relay flag assigned by the directory authorities.

  • first_seen_days (str) – Return only relays or bridges which have first been seen during the given range of days ago. A parameter value “x-y” with x <= y returns relays or bridges that have first been seen at least x and at most y days ago. Accepted short forms are “x”, “x-“, and “-y” which are interpreted as “x-x”, “x-infinity”, and “0-y”.

  • last_seen_days (str) – Return only relays or bridges which have last been seen during the given range of days ago. A parameter value “x-y” with x <= y returns relays or bridges that have last been seen at least x and at most y days ago. Accepted short forms are “x”, “x-“, and “-y” which are interpreted as “x-x”, “x-infinity”, and “0-y”.

  • contact (str) – Return only relays with the parameter value matching (part of) the contact line. If the parameter value contains spaces, only relays are returned which contain all space-separated parts in their contact line.

  • family (str) – Return only the relay whose fingerprint matches the parameter value and all relays that this relay has listed in its family by fingerprint and that in turn have listed this relay in their family by fingerprint.

  • version (str) – Return only relays or bridges running either Tor version from a list or range given in the parameter value. Tor versions must be provided without the leading “Tor” part. Multiple versions can either be provided as a comma-separated list (“,”), as a range separated by two dots (“..”), or as a list of ranges.

  • os (str) – Return only relays or bridges running on an operating system that starts with the parameter value.

  • host_name (str) – Return only relays with a domain name ending in the given (partial) host name. Searches for subdomains of a specific domain should ideally be prefixed with a period, for example: “.csail.mit.edu”.

  • recommended_version (bool) – Return only relays and bridges running a Tor software version that is recommended if recommended_version

  • fields (Tuple[str]) – Tuple of specific fields to return for each bridge/relay descriptor object.

  • order (Tuple[str]) – Re-order results by a comma-separated list of fields in ascending or descending order. Results are first ordered by the first list element, then by the second, and so on. Possible fields for ordering are: consensus_weight and first_seen. Field names are case-insensitive. Ascending order is the default; descending order is selected by prepending fields with a minus sign (-). Field names can be listed at most once in either ascending or descending order. Relays or bridges which don’t have any value for a field to be ordered by are always appended to the end, regardless or sorting order.

  • offset (int) – Skip the given number of relays and/or bridges. Relays are skipped first, then bridges.

  • limit (int) – Limit result to the given number of relays and/or bridges.

Return type

Response

async get_bandwidth(**kwargs)[source]¶

Get bandwidth document from API.

Parameters

  • as_name (str) – Return only relays with the parameter value matching part of) the autonomous system (AS) name they are located in. If the parameter value contains spaces, only relays are returned which contain all space-separated parts in their AS name.

  • flag (Flag) – Return only relays which have the given relay flag assigned by the directory authorities.

  • first_seen_days (str) – Return only relays or bridges which have first been seen during the given range of days ago. Accepted short forms are “x”, “x-“, and “-y” which are interpreted as “x-x”, “x-infinity”, and “0-y”.

  • contact (str) – Return only relays with the parameter value matching (part of) the contact line. If the parameter value contains spaces, only relays are returned which contain all space-separated parts in their contact line.

  • family (str) – Return only the relay whose fingerprint matches the parameter value and all relays that this relay has listed in its family by fingerprint and that in turn have listed this relay in their family by fingerprint.

  • version (str) – Return only relays or bridges running either Tor version from a list or range given in the parameter value. Tor versions must be provided without the leading “Tor” part. Multiple versions can either be provided as a comma-separated list (“,”), as a range separated by two dots (“..”), or as a list of ranges.

  • os (str) – Return only relays or bridges running on an operating system that starts with the parameter value.

  • host_name (str) – Return only relays with a domain name ending in the given (partial) host name. Searches for subdomains of a specific domain should ideally be prefixed with a period, for example: “.csail.mit.edu”.

  • recommended_version (bool) – Return only relays and bridges running a Tor software version that is recommended if recommended_version

  • order (Tuple[str]) – Re-order results by a comma-separated list of fields in ascending or descending order. Results are first ordered by the first list element, then by the second, and so on. Possible fields for ordering are: consensus_weight and first_seen. Field names are case-insensitive. Ascending order is the default; descending order is selected by prepending fields with a minus sign (-). Field names can be listed at most once in either ascending or descending order. Relays or bridges which don’t have any value for a field to be ordered by are always appended to the end, regardless or sorting order.

  • offset (int) – Skip the given number of relays and/or bridges. Relays are skipped first, then bridges.

  • limit (int) – Limit result to the given number of relays and/or bridges.

Return type

Response

async get_weights(**kwargs)[source]¶

Get weights document from API.

Parameters

  • type (str) – Specify to return only “relay” or “bridge” descriptors.

  • running (bool) – Return only running bridges/or relays.

  • lookup (str) – Return only the relay with the parameter value matching the fingerprint or the bridge with the parameter value matching the hashed fingerprint.

  • family (str) – Return only the relay whose fingerprint matches the parameter value and all relays that this relay has listed in its family by fingerprint and that in turn have listed this relay in their family by fingerprint.

  • version (str) – Return only relays or bridges running either Tor version from a list or range given in the parameter value. Tor versions must be provided without the leading “Tor” part. Multiple versions can either be provided as a comma-separated list (“,”), as a range separated by two dots (“..”), or as a list of ranges.

  • recommended_version (bool) – Return only relays and bridges running a Tor software version that is recommended if recommended_version

  • order (Tuple[str]) – Re-order results by a comma-separated list of fields in ascending or descending order. Results are first ordered by the first list element, then by the second, and so on. Possible fields for ordering are: consensus_weight and first_seen. Field names are case-insensitive. Ascending order is the default; descending order is selected by prepending fields with a minus sign (-). Field names can be listed at most once in either ascending or descending order. Relays or bridges which don’t have any value for a field to be ordered by are always appended to the end, regardless or sorting order.

  • offset (int) – Skip the given number of relays and/or bridges. Relays are skipped first, then bridges.

  • limit (int) – Limit result to the given number of relays and/or bridges.

async get_uptime(**kwargs)[source]¶

Get uptime document from API.

Parameters

  • type (str) – Specify to return only “relay” or “bridge” descriptors.

  • running (bool) – Return only running bridges/or relays.

  • lookup (str) – Return only the relay with the parameter value matching the fingerprint or the bridge with the parameter value matching the hashed fingerprint.

  • country (str) – Return only relays which are located in the given country as identified by a two-letter country code. Filtering by country code is case-insensitive. The special country code xz can be used for relays that were not found in the GeoIP database.

  • as (str) – Return only relays which are located in either one of the given autonomous systems (AS) as identified by AS number (with or without preceding “AS” part). Multiple AS numbers can be provided separated by commas. Filtering by AS number is case insensitive. The special AS number 0 can be used for relays that were not found in the GeoIP database.

  • last_seen_days (str) – Return only relays or bridges which have last been seen during the given range of days ago. Accepted short forms are “x”, “x-“, and “-y” which are interpreted as “x-x”, “x-infinity”, and “0-y”.

Possible fields for ordering are: consensus_weight and first_seen. Field names are case-insensitive. Ascending order is the default; descending order is selected by prepending fields with a minus sign (-). Field names can be listed at most once in either ascending or descending order. Relays or bridges which don’t have any value for a field to be ordered by are always appended to the end, regardless or sorting order.

  • offset (int) – Skip the given number of relays and/or bridges. Relays are skipped first, then bridges.

  • limit (int) – Limit result to the given number of relays and/or bridges.
